data.name: ElasticStrategyConservativeRecommendation
data.value: If you would like to choose a more conservative SKU that satisfies 100% of your current utilization needs, the cheapest one available is {0}, which results in an increase in monthly payment of {1}.

data.name: ElasticStrategyDbRecommendation
data.value: Based on the performance counters for your CPU, memory, storage, IOPS, and IO latency that were collected between {0} and {1}, the optimal AzureSqlDatabase SKU that we recommend you migrate to is: {2}. This SKU satisfies {3}% of your current utilization needs with a {4}x buffer on your current CPU usage.

data.name: ElasticStrategyMIRecommendation
data.value: Based on the performance counters for your CPU, memory, storage, IOPS, and IO latency that were collected between {0} and {1}, the optimal AzureSqlManagedInstance SKU that we recommend you migrate to is: {2}. This SKU satisfies {3}% of your current utilization needs with a {4}x buffer on your current CPU usage.

data.name: ElasticStrategyNegotiables
data.value: This elastic recommendation is made based on on-cloud Azure customers that exhibit similar behavior and that were comfortable with negotiating on {0}.

data.name: ElasticStrategyDoesNotMeetFileStorageRequirement
data.value: File Storage is larger than 8TB, No General Purpose file tier can satisfy the current file storage requirement.

data.name: MeetsDatabaseCpuScalingFactorRequirement
data.value: According to the performance data collected, we estimate that your database has a compute requirement of {0:n2} vCores. Based on other factors, including memory, storage, and IO, this is the smallest compute sizing that will satisfy all of your requirements.

data.name: MeetsDatabaseIOLatencyBCRequirement
data.value: This database requires {0:n2} milliseconds of IO latency, which can be satisfied by the Business Critical service tier.

data.name: MeetsDatabaseIOLatencyRequirement
data.value: This database requires {0:n2} milliseconds of IO latency, which is within the {1} service tier's threshold of {2} milliseconds.

data.name: MeetsDatabaseIOPSDataRequirement
data.value: This database requires {0:n0} IOPS for data files, which can be satisfied by this SKU's limit of {1} IOPS.

data.name: MeetsDatabaseIOThroughputRequirement
data.value: This database requires {0:n2} MB/s of combined read/write IO throughput. This is a relatively idle database, so IO latency is not considered.

data.name: MeetsDatabaseMemoryRequirement
data.value: This database requires {0:n2} GB of memory, which can be satisfied by this SKU's maximum of {1:n2} GB.

data.name: MeetsDatabaseStorageRequirement
data.value: This database requires {0:n2} GB of storage for data files. We recommend provisioning at least {1} GB of storage, which is the nearest valid amount that can be provisioned. Storage for this SKU is provisioned in increments of {2} GB, up to {3} GB.

data.name: MeetsInstanceCpuScalingFactorRequirement
data.value: According to the performance data collected, we estimate that your instance has a compute requirement of {0:n2} vCores. Based on other factors, including memory, storage, and IO, this is the smallest compute sizing that will satisfy all of your requirements.

data.name: MeetsInstanceIOLatencyBCRequirement
data.value: This instance requires {0:n2} milliseconds of IO latency, which can be satisfied by the Business Critical service tier.

data.name: MeetsInstanceIOLatencyGPRequirement
data.value: This instance requires {0:n2} milliseconds of IO latency, which is within the General Purpose service tier's threshold of {1} milliseconds.

data.name: MeetsInstanceIOPSDataLogRequirement
data.value: This instance requires {0:n0} IOPS for data and log files, which can be satisfied by this SKU's limit of {1} IOPS.

data.name: MeetsInstanceIOThroughputRequirement
data.value: This instance requires {0:n2} MB/second of combined read/write IO throughput. This is a relatively idle database, so IO latency is not considered.

data.name: MeetsInstanceMemoryRequirement
data.value: This instance requires {0:n2} GB of memory, which can be satisfied by this SKU's maximum of {1:n2} GB.

data.name: MeetsInstanceStorageRequirement
data.value: This instance requires {0:n2} GB of storage for data files, and {1:n2} GB of storage for log files. We recommend provisioning at least {2} GB of data storage, which is the nearest valid amount that can be provisioned which would include sufficient log storage. Storage for this SKU is provisioned in increments of {3} GB, up to {4} GB.

data.name: MeetsManagedDiskStorageRequirement
data.value: This instance's {0} storage requirement of {1:n2} GB and {2:n2} IOPS requirement will fit on {3} {4} disk(s), which can hold {5} GB each.

data.name: MeetsVirtualMachineIOPSRequirementUncached
data.value: This instance's IOPS requirement of {0:n2} is within this Virtual Machine size's uncached IOPS limit of {1}.

data.name: MeetsVirtualMachineIOThroughputUncachedRequirement

data.name: MeetsVirtualMachineMem2CoreRatioRequirement
data.value: This Virtual Machine size's Memory-to-vCore ratio of {0:n1} is greater than or equal to the recommended value of {1:n1}.

data.name: MeetsVirtualMachineTempStorageSpace
data.value: We recommend placing tempdb on the local ephemeral SSD. This Virtual Machine size supports temporary local storage of up to {0:n2} GB, which is large enough to host your {1:n2} GB tempdb.

data.value: We recommend provisioning dedicated disks for {0} storage.

data.name: StorageLayoutExceedsVirtualMachineUncachedIOPSLimit

data.name: NoRecommendationReturned

data.name: CustomScalingFactorProvided
data.value: A custom scaling factor of {0}% was provided, which will be considered when evaluating the performance characteristics of your source.

data.name: DoesNotMeetInstanceIOPSDataLogRequirement
data.value: This instance's IOPS requirement of {0} exceeds this SKU's limit of {1} IOPS.

data.name: MeetsInstanceIOPSDataLogGPRequirement
data.value: This instance requires {0:n0} IOPS for data and log files. Based on your current file sizes, this SKU can achieve {1:n0} IOPS if you migrate as-is. You might improve IO performance by increasing file sizes. For more information, visit https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-sql/managed-instance/resource-limits.

data.value: This SKU provides more compute than your source requires. However, the smaller {0} vCore SKU was not recommended because: {1}
data.comment: {1} will be replaced with another justification from this file

data.name: DoesNotMeetManagedDiskCachingRequirement
data.value: This managed disk has a maximum size of {0} GB, but disk caching is not supported since the size is greater than or equal to {1} GB.

data.name: DoesNotMeetManagedDiskTypeRequirement
data.value: This managed disk should be a Premium SSD for production environments, or Standard SSD or Premium SSD for dev/test environments.

data.name: DoesNotMeetVirtualMachineFamilyTypeRequirement
data.value: This Virtual Machine series is not of General Purpose or Memory Optimized type.

data.name: DoesNotMeetVirtualMachineNICRequirement
data.value: This Virtual Machine size supports a maximum of {0} NICs, which is not enough to support this host's requirement of {1} NICs.

data.name: DoesNotMeetVirtualMachineTempDbStorageRequirement
data.value: This Virtual Machine size does not support local storage, which is needed to host your {0:n2} GB tempdb.

data.name: ManagedDiskDoesNotMeetVirtualMachineCachingRequirement
data.value: The Virtual Machine meets IOPS/throughput requirement with caching ON. However, caching is not supported with managed disk size {0} for {1} disk.

data.value: The instance's {0} storage requirement will fit on {1} {2} disks. However, it exceeds the max disks that can be attached to the Virtual Machine.

data.name: MeetsManagedDiskCachingRequirement
data.value: This managed disk meets the disk caching requirements for production environments.

data.name: MeetsManagedDiskTypeRequirement
data.value: This managed disk is a {0}, which meets the requirements for dev/test environments.

data.name: MeetsVirtualMachineIOPSRequirementWithCachingOn
data.value: This instance's IOPS requirement of {0} is not within this Virtual Machine size's uncached IOPS limit of {1}. However, enabling caching can improve IO by up to 30%, so this VM can provide up to {2:n2} IOPS with caching enabled.

data.name: MeetsVirtualMachineIOThroughputRequirementWithCachingOn
data.value: This instance's IO throughput requirement of {0:n2} MBps is not within this Virtual Machine size's uncached limit of {1} MBps. However, enabling caching can improve IO by up to 30%, so this VM can provide up to {2:n2} MBps with caching enabled.

data.name: MeetsVirtualMachineNICRequirement
data.value: This Virtual Machine size supports a maximum of {0} NICs, which meets this host's requirement of {1} NICs.

data.name: MeetsVirtualMachineNICThresholdRequirement
data.value: This Virtual Machine size supports a maximum of {0} NICs, and this host's requirement is {1} NICs, which both exceed the threshold of {2} NICs.

data.name: DoesNotMeetMiMaximumDatabaseCountRequirement
data.value: This instance contains {0} databases, which exceeds Azure SQL Managed Instance's limit of {1} databases per instance.

data.name: DoesNotMeetInstanceLogStorageRequirement
data.value: This instance's log storage requirement of {0:n2} GB exceeds {1}% of this SKU's data storage limit of {2} GB.

data.name: DoesNotMeetDatabaseLogWriteRateRequirement
data.value: This database's log write rate requirement of {0:n2} MB/s exceeds this SKU's max log rate limit of {1:n0} MB/s.

data.name: MeetsDatabaseLogWriteRateRequirement
data.value: This database requires a {0:n2} MB/s log write rate, which can be satisfied by this SKU's max log rate limit of {1:n0} MB/s.

data.name: MeetsDatabaseLogWriteRateBCRequirement
data.value: This database requires a {0:n2} MB/s log write rate, which can be satisfied by the Business Critical service tier.

data.name: DoesNotMeetManagedDiskMinimumSizeRequirement
data.value: P1 disks are currently not supported during the provisioning of SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines at this time.

data.name: DoesNotMeetDatabaseReplicaRequirement
data.value: This database's sync read, sync non-read, async read, and async non-read replica requirements of {0}/{1}/{2}/{3} is too large for this configuration.

data.name: MeetsDatabaseReplicaRequirementWithoutSecondaries
data.value: One {0} primary database provides a sufficient number of replicas for your source database's needs.

data.name: MeetsDatabaseReplicaRequirementWithSecondaries
data.value: One {0} primary database with {1} {2} secondaries in a {3} configuration provides a sufficient number of replicas for your source database's needs.

data.name: DoesNotMeetInstanceReplicaRequirement
data.value: This instance's sync read, sync non-read, async read, and async non-read replica requirements of {0}/{1}/{2}/{3} is too large for this configuration.

data.name: AlwaysOnDatabaseFCIZoneRedundancyAvailable
data.value: With database zone redundancy enabled, your source redundancy requirements are satisfied.

data.name: AlwaysOnDatabaseFCIZoneRedundancyNotAvailable
data.value: We recommend provisioning a secondary active geo-replica to satisfy your source redundancy requirements.

data.name: AlwaysOnInstanceFCI
data.value: We recommend provisioning a secondary failover group instance to satisfy your source redundancy requirements.

data.name: AlwaysOnVirtualMachineFCICloudWitness
data.value: Because internet access is available, we recommend using a cloud witness.

data.name: AlwaysOnVirtualMachineFCIDiskWitness
data.value: Because internet access is not available, we recommend using a disk witness.

data.name: AlwaysOnVirtualMachineFCIReplicatedDisks
data.value: We recommend provisioning a secondary virtual machine with replicated disks to satisfy your source redundancy requirements.

data.name: AlwaysOnVirtualMachineFCISharedZRSDisks
data.value: We recommend provisioning a secondary virtual machine with shared disks to satisfy your source redundancy requirements.

data.name: MeetsInstanceReplicaRequirementWithoutSecondaries
data.value: One {0} primary instance provides a sufficient number of replicas for your source instance's needs.

data.name: MeetsInstanceReplicaRequirementWithSecondaries
data.value: One {0} primary instance with {1} {2} secondaries in a {3} configuration provides a sufficient number of replicas for your source instance's needs.
